data.title: Khalsa Community School
data.meta_description: Khalsa Community School is a private school in Brampton, Ontario, Canada. It offers classroom instruction from Pre-Kindergarten to Grade 12, within a framework of the Sikh religion and Sikh philosophy.
data.meta_site_name: Randy Selzer: Your Real Estate Agent in Mississauga Agent in Mississauga
data.text:
Khalsa Community School Brampton

Khalsa Community School is a private school in Brampton, Ontario, Canada.

The school is fully registered with the Ontario Ministry of Education. KCS offers the standard Ontario Education Curriculum within a framework of the Sikh faith and Sikh philosophy.

Khalsa Community School is both an elementary school and a high school. It offers primary education for Junior Kindergarten to Grade 8, as well as high school education for grades 9-12.

The school was founded in 1995, and has grown in size where there are now over 800 registered students in all. Even with this growth, KCS has maintained the value of ‘small school camaraderie’ which is about welcoming everyone and working collaboratively.

Class sizes are tailored for individual attention. The school puts an emphasis on individual achievement and the overall development of the necessary skills for success.

Evaluation criteria ensure high academic standards that promote success for graduates.

Academic Programs

What specialized academic programs are offered at Khalsa Community School in Brampton?

International Baccalaureate IB

Khalsa Community is an IB World School, offering the Middle Years Programme. The International Baccalaureate Middle Years Programme (MYP) is an educational programme for students between the ages of 11 and 16 as part of the International Baccalaureate (IB) continuum. The Middle Years Programme is intended to prepare students for the two-year IB Diploma Programme.

The MYP encourages students to make practical connections between their studies and the real world, preparing them for success in further study and in life.

The International Baccalaureate is a worldwide network of schools that provide academically challenging instruction for student participants from pre-school age to high school.

Brampton, ON L6S 3B5

Phone number: 905-791-1750

School Board: None

Academic Calendar: Semesters

School Size: students: 800

Religious Affiliation: Khalsa Sikhism

Foundation Year: 1995

School Uniform: YES

Tuition Fees: Yes, see school website for further info

Language of Instruction: English and Punjabi

School Facilities

Khalsa Community School offers a good assortment of modern classrooms and work spaces for students.

In addition, the school also features numerous drama and art rooms, music areas, a gymnasium, a fitness centre, plus athletic fields and computer study areas.

Sports

For a relatively small school, KCS has a decent offering of individual and team (Lions) sports, including:

Badminton

Basketball

Cross-country

Field Hockey

Gaelic Football

Skating

Skiing

Soccer

Volleyball

Extracurricular Clubs and Events

What clubs and events are available for students to participate in at Khalsa Community School? KCS has a respectable list of extracurricular clubs and events, including:

annual fest

book club

citizenship club

debating club

Khalsa Olympic day

Kirtan Darbar

Punjabi writing competition

robotics club

school band

school book fairs

school idol show

science fair

speech competition

student council

talent show

visual art show

writing club

yearbook club

Khalsa Community Secondary School Ranking

This private high school has consistently scored highly in the Fraser Institute’s annual ranking. This year’s score was 7.8 out of a possible 10, and the school is tied for 84th place out of 739 high schools in the province of Ontario. Compare school rankings.

School and Nearby Amenities

For recreation, the school has a gymnasium, and a full assortment of track and field facilities.

KCS is located in an established area of east Brampton (Bramalea). There are a lot of commercial areas nearby along Queen Street. E., including Bramalea City Centre mall, which is a 5 minute drive away.

Boundary Map

click map to enlarge

As a private specialty school, Khalsa Community School boundaries include the entirety of Brampton.

IMPORTANT DISCLAIMER: Not all boundaries are included. We make every effort to ensure that school and district boundary data is up-to-date. It’s important to note, however, that these are approximations and are for general informational purposes only. To verify exact boundaries or school locations, contact the school directly.

Conclusion

Khalsa Community School has an excellent score in the provincial rankings for all high schools in Ontario as shown by ranking results from the Fraser Institute.

It also provides a good array of sports and extracurricular activities that will enrich students’ academic experience in grades 9-12.
